meanings.definition: Disgusting or unpleasant in taste or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The food looked yechy and made me feel sick.
meanings.sent2: The garbage had a yechy smell that lingered in the air.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped on a yechy banana peel and slipped!
meanings.sent4: The yechy taste of failure lingered in his mouth.
meanings.sent5: The yechy smell of the old socks filled the room.

meanings.definition: Feeling or expressing disgust or aversion.
meanings.sent1: She made a yechy face when she saw the slimy snail.
meanings.sent2: He had a yechy reaction to the spoiled milk.
meanings.sent3: The yechy movie made everyone cringe and laugh at the same time.
meanings.sent4: Her yechy attitude towards cleaning made the task even harder.
meanings.sent5: The yechy feeling of betrayal stayed with him for days.

meanings.definition: Something that is gross or revolting.
meanings.sent1: The yechy in the trash can attracted flies.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't stand the yechy on the horror movie.
meanings.sent3: The yechy in the haunted house was just plastic spiders.
meanings.sent4: The yechy of the situation made her want to leave immediately.
meanings.sent5: The yechy of the old cheese made her gag.
